column4: i have a powershot sx100 is canon camera. plugging it through the usb cable works, the photos even show on my computer, as i try to open one of them no program is able to. cant transfer them onto my computer. do i need to download a driver? how can i knonw if ubuntu (latest version) supports this model?
he means raw data format rather than, say, a .jpg... what are you trying to open them with?
BinaryMaster when they show up on my computer the ending is .jpg
then I will need the actual error with a specific program.
okay there is an error with image viewer. ill tell you in a minute
see if you can open them with GIMP.
i have gimp, ill try that next time if it doesnt work
displayed as a thumbnail in Nautilus?
latest version, if thats the name then yes
Nautilus is the file manager for Ubuntu...
oh yes its in the cameras folder, adn then dcim....
while in the directory where you see the thumbnail, press ctrl + L  and paste the path at the top which appears
ok
gphoto2://[usb:001,025]/DCIM/100CANON
i see. what do i do about that
dunno how to do that

I use KDE... but at the top of Dolphin, we have a "split" button which will allow us to drag and drop from one dir to another in the same window... just open another file manager if you dont, and drag and drop one and see if you can open it locallyw ithout a problem.
do i have another file manager?
you can open multiple instances I mean
it would be the same manager. or do you mean a separate window ? like go into a different folder in a separate window? and then what? drag and drop a file into there?
ok let me try
because you are viewing it in thumbnail mode... It has to read all of your very large picture files and then convert then to thumbs, nd then display them
